reviews.review: Ricochet is a weird game. You hop around on platforms in a futuristic setting and throw discs at other players, similar to Tron. This game is rather old, so the graphics aren't the greatest. The sound effects are lacking, and I don't recall any music. The biggest reason that I don't recommend this is because of the lack of servers. There were usually only 3-5 servers while I was playing, and most were empty or had a few bots. It would be nice if there was an offline mode with bots, but like many of the old goldsrc games, there is not. If you really want to try this out, you should definitely wait for a sale or get it in the Counter-Strike 1 Anthology.

It's a cool game with interesting mechanics, but I can never seem to find a decent server. People don't really play this game anymore, unfortunately. And, unfortunately, a multiplayer game needs players for it to be fun. I'm a sucker for Tron-style things, but this game is, sadly, a desolate wasteland in its current state. I probably would have had a blast with this game when it first came out, but I guess I came in too late.

Maybe this review can be considered a recommendation for others to play it, so I can have the actual opportunity to give this game the chance it deserves.

I, personally, am game for a Ricochet 2. Get on it, Valve. We all know you're not really working on finishing Half-life 2.

A cult hit and one that Valve considers ahead of its time. Ricochet is an enjoyable arena-style FPS with careful jumping and precise disc throwing being the focus of the game. A friendly community will show you the ropes, and the servers are usually populated, so find a game and give Ricochet a shot.
Ein Meisterwerk der Künste. Genau so, wie wenn sich Yoko Ono in eine Kunstgalerie stellt und 2 Minuten lang in ein Mikro schreit.

Étant un grand fan d'E-sport, je me baladais sur le magasin Steam au gré des vents, et mes yeux se posèrent sur ce jeu: Ricochet.
Je me décide donc d'acheter ce jeu, 4.99€. Je me dis tout d'abord que c'est donné, sachant cet achat sera vite amorti par les compétitions.

Le jeu se télécharge au bout d'à peine une petite seconde, je pensais que c'était un rêve, j'ai retiré mes lunettes, pris un mouchoir de la marque "caresse", et j'ai nettoyé mes lunettes, dommage, c'est des mouchoirs de la marque Leclerc, c'est donc de la merde, mes lunettes sont donc encore pleines de traces.
Je pars donc à Super U, car là-bas, leurs mouchoirs sont de meilleure qualité. J'ai donc acheté des Kleenex, certes ce n'est pas la marque U, mais c'est le magasin le plus proche de chez moi, en effet ce magasin se trouve à 10 minutes en voiture, une aubaine pour moi.
Je nettoie donc mes lunettes, maintenant elles sont propres, merci Kleenex.
Je vérifie ensuite ma connexion, tout est normal.

Je me dis que ce jeu va vraiment être sympa, car il s'est dl en à peine une seconde, et en plus mes lunettes sont propres et ma connexion marche au poil.

Étant impatient de découvrir les merveilles que renferme ce jeu, je clique à l'aide de ma souris sur le bouton "Jouer", le jeu se lance... Quand soudain... un écran noir.
Mon ordinateur s'était éteint, il y'avait une coupure de courant.

Malheur et déséspoir s'emparèrent de mon ètre, je me leva, pleura, je me mis en boule sur mon lit... sans même mettre de couverture.

Puis le courant revient, je rallume donc mon ordinateur... je démarre Steam... Puis Ricochet... et la...rien.

Parce qu'en fait Ricochet c'est rien. Le vide. Le néant. Je rentre donc dans ce néant calme et apaisant et me laisse emporter par ce jeu... j'y suis resté, une heure, deux heures, trois heures... 53 heures d'un seul coup.

Une fois ressorti de ce néant, j'entends une voix dans ma tête, c'était le saint gobelet, il me guidait vers ma destinée, j'ai donc décidé de fonder une religion dont j'allais devenir le prophète et dont le dieu serait le Saint-Gobelet.

Suivez le Saint-Gobelet

Jeux parfaits n'existent pas. Et Ricochet ne fait pas exception. C'est un mod de Half life 1 extrêmement bien construit et accueillant, qui a encore quelques petits défauts que vous ne pouvez pas négliger. D'autre part, il a une liberté inégalée, une bonne ambiance, ainsi qu'une histoire très prenante. Une très grande référence dans le genre ! Je le recommande à tous.

Based off of the popular film TRON, Ricochet gives players the freedom of a massive multiplayer deathmatch with an array of strategy with its fine jumps and skills. Valve's greatest game to date for such a low price -- it's hardly something to pass up. 

This game features the best graphics ever seen on a PC so unfortunately you'll need a powerful computer to run it. It also packs a punch with its fantastic physics engine with realistic jumping, throwing and cloth effects. Comes with an incredible soundtrack for the ages, every song is absolutely phenominal and they are all must-haves for your MP3 player.

In summary: this is one of, if not the, best multiplayer games on PC. I highly recommend purchasing this wonderful title. You will not be dissatisfied.

At first I thought it was something Valve employees made during one of their lunch breaks while developing Half-Life 1. Then I played it.

Well, apparently it is so. But that's not all there is to it.

Although Ricochet still looks like it was made in 20 minutes and is a Half-Life 1 mod, I managed to enjoy it immensely. As a stand-alone game, nah, it's not a masterpiece. As a lunch break filler, ironically, it is simply amazing. And is best with friends and voice chat.

That is, because of its original gameplay mechanics, and fast pace. You'll actaully spend quite some time to master it, and believe me, nothing feels better (during a lunch break). A great time killer if you ask me, though might not be for everyone. Graphics are obviously outdated, but that isn't exactly what you're looking for in this game. You're looking [i]at[/i] them though. Huehuehue

So, a 7/10 - would play during lunch break.

Orgasms occur regularly whilst you play this game. So, have the Kleenex ready and get ready to play Ricochet.
Better than CS:GO

Ricochet is a hard game to judge. It is a multi-player only mod that only ever had a handful of players, even back in the day, before Half-Life 2 was released and all the old mods for the original Half-Life started slowly dying off. Nowadays it is a dead game, a pointless purchase and install made even more futile by the fact that it was originally a free mod.

I did however, find it to be somewhat entertaining with a group of friends, if only for the chaos of it all. Not the best at what it does mind you but if you own it anyways and have friends that own it you might as well try and organize a game.
I chose to buy this game, while my friend chose to put a five dollar bill in a shredder. We were both equally satisfied by our choices.

Ricochet – игра, незаслуженно забытая, но до сих пор продолжающая доставлять, особенно когда на одном сервере собирается большая дружеская компания! ;)

Wow! Valve has done it again! From the creators of the Half-Life and their amazing expansion Half-Life: Opposing Force, I am proud to say that Valve has set a new standard for the gaming industry.

The first time I started Ricochet I was mesmerized by the visuals, the dark tone, and the sounds! I felt very immersed in the universe of Ricochet and the backdrop of space is truly amazing.

The main cast felt very believable, and I like the balance between emotionally driven characters and logically driven characters. I especially liked the side missions J'Chak has! Though some characters I feel got left in the dust, looking at you H'Jird!

The factions you get to join are truly amazing! From the Galactic Wardens to the Dark Cult of O'Kgha. These are just two of over 12 factions I've encountered so far, each with their own agenda and outlook on the universe.

I love the gameplay mechanics, the discs felt VERY impactful! The controlls are amazing and every turn I did felt sharp and on point, I also didnt feel too fast or too slow. The jumping mechanics are very good, but considering Valves last entry this is expected.

Overall I give this game a 9.2/10, it really has shaken the industry with revolutionary design and gameplay, but lacks character development with some side characters that I wanted to know more about.

The most bizarre game I have ever played ( well, excluding that president's cat game, but you can't really compare these two). You play as a tall, scary and intimidating fellow with a very interesting hair cut. The goal is to...wait for it...  yes you guessed... tear your opponent to pieces with what seems to be a handful of deadly glow in the dark frisbees. Join the right server and cries of "holy shit" by an OTT American announcer, will add to the confusion. Its probably even more strange playing it whilst drunk or high, but I've yet to try it, so if you can provide feedback on this, then do a public service and post your findings in a comment.
